data.text:
For people forced to flee violence or persecution, staying at home to avoid #COVID19 is not an option. 

Yet access to asylum & other rights that would protect vulnerable refugees has been significantly curtailed during the pandemic.

More from @Refugees. https://t.co/gaFa2TBoZs

"Before receiving these clothes, my son was shivering from the cold at night - now he is warm."

Through conflict and #COVID19, @UNICEF is supporting families in Iraq during the harsh winter months. https://t.co/4tT7xmqCZk

Stories of Holocaust survivors bear witness to the horrors of racism & antisemitism left unchecked.

🎧 A new podcast series highlighting voices of resistance, resilience & courage reminds us of the urgent need to fight injustice & stop hatred.
https://t.co/PivAxGYn3H

Preserving our ocean & its resources protects our future.

2021 is the start of the #OceanDecade. https://t.co/WFnzu5ylw6 https://t.co/gPJ5YM6KsU

Whatever you are doing to stop the spread of #COVID19 – keep it up.
Preventing the further spread of #coronavirus is a shared responsibility for us all.

🎨: @karinamuranaga https://t.co/nqIWTlvZvx

Human trafficking victims are most often subjected to sexual exploitation, although trafficking for forced labour has increased significantly since 2006.

Details in latest @UNODC #EndHumanTrafficking report: https://t.co/k6JCXee2nB https://t.co/95hXFRTqnI

The 2021 @FoodSystems Summit will help unleash ambitious new actions & solutions to transform food systems worldwide. 🍎🥕🌾

Learn more, including how YOU can take part & help achieve the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/FyimkVZk5S

The COVAX facility, co-led by @WHO, brings together 180+ nations, ensuring low & middle-income countries receive #COVID19 vaccines.
 
None of us are safe until all of us are safe.
https://t.co/qqibfLCY53 https://t.co/hiIbCg66WD

The total cost of @UNPeacekeeping operations equals less than 0.5% of global military spending.

More than 90,000 men & women are #ServingForPeace in 12 peacekeeping operations worldwide. https://t.co/1AkYG74EeJ https://t.co/SVT4avTHQ7

"We believe in women's and girls' rights and choices." 

@Atayeshe talks with @MelissaFleming about @UNFPA's work to eliminate female genital mutilation & ensure a better future for millions of young girls on Awake At Night. https://t.co/9QPNDQ2B6B #EndFGM https://t.co/RwnBmUyVvJ

Female genital mutilation is a human rights violation that prevents girls and women from realizing their rights and full potential. 

Join @un_women in calling for concrete actions to end this harmful practice that has no medical justification. https://t.co/SKZdMvbSJZ #EndFGM https://t.co/wOHK7ZALja

.@Refugees Chief @FilippoGrandi praises decision by @POTUS to raise cap on number of refugees that can be admitted to the United States.

Announcement comes as global resettlement reaches lowest level in nearly two decades. https://t.co/I7tyh9YIdK https://t.co/Dcy986ebyg

On Saturday's #EndFGM Day, a new virtual exhibit from the UN showcases women who are using their voices to spread awareness of female genital mutilation and bring an end to this abhorrent practice. https://t.co/OW43LzKanC https://t.co/zGQMdwxZdi

With support from @IAMJHUD, Kate Winslet & @baobabstudios, #BabaYagaVR is helping to highlight the importance of protecting our planet's natural resources. 

Every #ClimateAction counts! 

Take a virtual reality journey with the #ActNow app: https://t.co/4i2kqgHfrb https://t.co/Stbie2sPAF

Female genital mutilation is rooted in gender inequalities, power imbalances & the social norms that uphold them.

On Saturday's #EndFGM Day, meet women who are driving change in their communities, and join the global movement to end this harmful practice. https://t.co/zVwAM8U0oD https://t.co/ZF188a3hzw

The shadow pandemic of gender-based violence caused by #COVID19 could put an additional 2 million girls at risk of female genital mutilation by 2030.

On Saturday's #EndFGM Day, see how @UNFPA & @UNICEF are working to end this harmful practice: https://t.co/xicMqnB3aA https://t.co/XKfJ15poWx

From donating face masks, and strengthening health systems to ensuring a resilient recovery, the UN works around the world to support the fight against #COVID19.

See some examples in our latest @TwitterMoments:
https://t.co/OI0bM7qfGT

How can we recover our world after #COVID19? Will we return to the same ways or will we decide together that something better is possible?

Decide #ItsPossible. https://t.co/j4SVI5nQK8 https://t.co/igANi4DVM9

♻ Reduce, reuse & recycle.

These steps can help tackle the climate emergency and reduce waste & plastic pollution.

#ActNow and make small changes in your everyday life that can have a big impact. https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV #ClimateAction https://t.co/ggHCY2orGp

People with disabilities are among the most vulnerable groups in a health crisis such as #COVID19.

Reducing inequalities will be critical to recover better and rebuild our economies & societies after the pandemic. https://t.co/A69bsMgtt1 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/ocCF9JtTi5

"Gender equality is possible. We must make it happen. Together."

The new year provides an opportunity for greater efforts to achieve gender equality, says @antonioguterres.

More on his 2021 priorities, including #COVID19 and #ClimateAction: https://t.co/rxXHMRQosL https://t.co/a0heKusy89

As antisemitism makes a resurgence in parts of the world, the stories & voices of Holocaust survivors are as invaluable as ever.

More than 76 years after the liberation of Auschwitz-Birkenau, listen to their reflections. 🎧 https://t.co/gUN6GvR6LJ

Good #ClimateAction news: 

Latin America & the Caribbean has adopted a regional plan to promote the recovery of 🌳 terrestrial, 🌊 marine & 🏝 coastal ecosystems in the next decade. #ForNature via @UNEP
https://t.co/dbRUYrtoj7

Security Council expresses deep concern over state of emergency imposed in Myanmar by the military and calls for immediate release of Aung San Suu Kyi and others who were detained arbitrarily. https://t.co/WZxeXqBdm4

The @IntlCrimCourt finds former commander of the Lord's Resistance Army in Uganda guilty of 61 crimes against humanity and war crimes.

https://t.co/28E42Xg9hK

#COVID19 has severely impacted cancer care & treatment in many countries around the world, and could result in increasing death tolls in the coming years, warns @WHO.

Thursday is #WorldCancerDay. https://t.co/6KxiglhZvW

"Let us commit to do more to promote cultural and religious tolerance, understanding and dialogue."

-- @antonioguterres on Thursday's first-ever #HumanFraternityDay. https://t.co/rL6pd4obwX https://t.co/cgRUpTVtPQ

Radiotherapy has been essential to cancer treatment for more than a century. 

On Thursday's #WorldCancerDay, @iaeaorg explains how nuclear science & tech are key to better cancer treatments. https://t.co/WlTZjBDLB6

https://t.co/m78JljiGfa

"Restoring the ocean’s ability to nurture humanity & regulate the climate is a defining challenge."

-- @antonioguterres at launch of #OceanDecade.
https://t.co/vim0keu40Y

Cancer is preventable & treatable. 

On Thursday's #WorldCancerDay, @WHO has suggestions on ways you can reduce you risk of developing cancer. https://t.co/ItHWcgZ832 https://t.co/BhDlPUowFt

We can all stand up for dialogue, interfaith harmony and mutual respect in the spirit of human fraternity.

Thursday is the first-ever #HumanFraternityDay. https://t.co/rL6pd46AFp https://t.co/3js2MnKtli

1 in 5 people will develop cancer before the age of 75. 

Reducing risk factors & early diagnosis are key to beating it.

More from @WHO on Thursday's #WorldCancerDay. https://t.co/ItHWcgHxbu https://t.co/AUPXQeqF0Z

The preliminary distribution plan for COVAX, the UN-led #COVID19 vaccine initiative, has been released. 

The effort is designed to help promote equitable access to the life-saving vaccine. https://t.co/qqibfLUztD

It's World Interfaith Harmony Week -- an opportunity to recall the power of mutual respect & understanding. 

See how @UNAOC is working toward a world of greater solidarity & unity amid the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/nYIpcXIUoi

Mountaineer specialists from Nepal recently deployed snow equipment to Mount Hermon to ensure their work for @UNDOF in the Golan can continue.

More on the women & men #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping around the world: https://t.co/1AkYG6N3nb https://t.co/7Q4Romz3JY

Amid #COVID19, none of us are safe until all of us are safe.

Ensuring refugees are included in national vaccination plans is vital for protecting as many people as possible & finally ending the pandemic. https://t.co/4XBMxWC2k0 via @Refugees https://t.co/LWG9C36FTN

Each year, more than 8 million tonnes of plastic end up in the ocean.

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero and help protect our water resources by avoiding single-use plastics, taking shorter showers and turning off the tap when brushing your teeth. https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 #ActNow https://t.co/MKE54zjyMO

At the height of the #COVID19 pandemic, 193 countries & regions temporarily closed educational institutions, affecting 1.7 billion students.

Ongoing school closures due to the crisis are likely to increase gender gaps in education. 

More from @UN_Women: https://t.co/QP0wD20tJk https://t.co/zNrVMyo2Qu

In Brazil, @UNmigration is delivering essential goods to indigenous and rural communities in the northern part of the country, and supporting local efforts to prevent the spread of #COVID19: https://t.co/zgDC7O0aI9 https://t.co/9T7ptnnbFP

We are here to help minimize the sever impact of conflict on civilians.

-- @refugees chief @FilippoGrandi says about humanitarian crisis in Tigray region, concluding his visit to Ethiopia. https://t.co/WC4Drji8tq https://t.co/7OVAEv5WvB

“I strongly condemn the recent steps taken by the military and urge all of you to collectively send a clear signal in support of democracy in Myanmar.” 

-- UN Special Envoy Christine Schraner Burgener to Security Council. https://t.co/OpLStzWUTk

It will cost the global economy $9.2 trillion if we don't share #COVID19 vaccines equally around the world.

None of us are safe until all of us are safe.

https://t.co/j4SVI56fSA https://t.co/SkLySUhTeY

#COVID19 is likely to increase trafficking in persons due to higher unemployment rates, which have left many job seekers vulnerable to traffickers.

Details in new @UNODC #EndHumanTrafficking report: https://t.co/k6JCXevDMb https://t.co/5OhqlwR8YC

It's Interfaith Harmony Week! 

See how @UNAOC promotes mutual respect & solidarity among people around the world, including in the face of #COVID19. https://t.co/Dbm8f2PeTR

The world has lost 70% of its natural wetlands over the last 100 years. That has also lead to a significant loss of freshwater species.

More on the importance of wetlands for life on earth on Tuesday's #WorldWetlandsDay: https://t.co/NSOHlrt3FA https://t.co/oYiwsl6rQM

Less than 1% of water on Earth is usable freshwater and most of it is stored in wetlands.

On Tuesday's #WorldWetlandsDay, find out more about the importance of wetlands for life: https://t.co/NSOHlrKEx8 https://t.co/63lFWxl4rD

"There is a human face behind this tragedy. There are 200 grieving mothers who feel just as deeply as I do"

@sas_yvonne was working for @UNESCWA in Beirut, when an explosion devastated much of the city & killed her two-year-old son Isaac on 4 August 2020. https://t.co/oYIM3tfqfE https://t.co/lOpEsNJ5uF

Water & wetlands are inseparably connected and are vital to human life & the health of our planet. 

Yet, humans use more freshwater than nature can replenish, with devastating consequences for wetlands. 

Tuesday is #WorldWetlandsDay. https://t.co/NSOHlrt3FA via @UN_Water https://t.co/1GAj88nUyA

📸: #Thowback to March 1950, when then United Nations Secretary-General Trygve Lie, took his 3-year-old grandson on a tour of UNHQ in NYC.

Monday marks 75 years since Trygve Lie was elected the UN's first Secretary-General.

Read about his legacy: https://t.co/krZQgQjnMz #UN75 https://t.co/pcJPrsTQ0V

Recognition
Justice
Development

#BlackHistoryMonth gets underway on Monday - an opportunity to #FightRacism & learn out about the International Decade of People of African Descent: https://t.co/SyNBqTcw93 https://t.co/Cs5JweXLrh

The United Kingdom assumes the presidency of the Security Council for the month of February.
Follow @UKUN_NewYork for updates. https://t.co/03hQ17lzYh https://t.co/mdYK2iqrNr

Nearly 1 in 10 children are subjected to child labour worldwide, resulting in them being cut off from schooling & health care, which threatens their well-being & future. via @UNICEF #EndChildLabour https://t.co/HR9Wy4MFr5

The climate crisis has not stopped amid #COVID19. Delaying #ClimateAction costs livelihoods & lives.

#ActNow to help protect our planet & our future: Switching off lights can save more energy than it takes for the light to start up again. https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/7GGda23Rcz

"Now is the time to secure the well-being of people, economies, societies and our planet. It is possible. So we must make it happen. Together."

-- @antonioguterres' priorities for 2021 include #COVID19, #ClimateAction & more. https://t.co/A68StYHf3n https://t.co/IsVAp2D3mM

🎮In 2020, more than 110 million players supported green initiatives like tree planting🌳🌴🌲 through activations in video games like Angry Birds & Subway Surfers.

@UNEP explains how the video gaming industry is taking #ClimateAction: https://t.co/Ct8YH6TSAw

In addition to their core duties, the men & women #ServingForPeace with @MONUSCO help facilitate the movement of people & goods through road rehabilitation projects.

More on the @UNPeacekeeping mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo: https://t.co/nqlMMDlTAz #A4P https://t.co/Q6OMe1m0Fu

The equivalent of 225 million full-time jobs have been lost due to the #COVID19 pandemic, according to @ILO.

A slow, uneven & uncertain recovery is expected in 2021.
https://t.co/RT1aiE5oRD
On Sunday's #WorldLeprosyDay, learn how @WHO is working to end stigma and support the well-being of those who have experienced leprosy. https://t.co/MHMgdo8w3b https://t.co/Dmc871MtDp

"Let's give science the credit and the trust it deserves." 

-- UN communications chief @MelissaFleming talks to @WebMD's @drjohnwhyte about the importance of communicating science-based information to help people navigate the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/FOaPP0dKjg

Sunday is #WorldLeprosyDay.

Ending the stigma associated with the disease and ensuring early detection are key for leprosy treatment & recovery. https://t.co/sbQZ8ygoBM via @WHO https://t.co/S12nsSwgIo

We are in this together - and we will get through this, together.

The UN is working around the clock to help people all over the world in the fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/3EHAHiVpp3

🎨: Giulia Corti https://t.co/VmgpvYzHkr

1.5 million people shared their hopes for the future & how the UN can help them reach their aspirations in the #UN75 survey. 

The majority of people support international cooperation, especially amid #COVID19, the climate crisis & widening inequalities. 
https://t.co/XDQtdFgaoS https://t.co/0CSTBMYlOB

Strong women can help inspire strong girls - and together, we can all help achieve #GenerationEquality.

@UN_Women works to promote gender equality around the world. https://t.co/9DkJpsP6x9 https://t.co/CDPkNUETb6

2020 was a record low for refugee resettlement.

More resettlement places are needed to help protect those who are most at risk & in greatest need, says @Refugees. https://t.co/y4GC9rkTPs

More than 2 million people have died from #COVID19.

We remember all those we have loved and lost to this deadly disease. 

https://t.co/LFKnUNREf3 https://t.co/roW5sjknnM

"The world cannot turn its back on this crisis, which is going from bad to worse."

-- UN official @MarkCutts says 120,000 people in camps in northwest Syria are facing catastrophic situation after floods damaged or destroyed at least 21,000 tents. https://t.co/CgKNxDf1cQ

"2021 must be the year to change gear and put the world on track.

We need to move from death to health; from disaster to reconstruction; from despair to hope; from business as usual to transformation."

-- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/oljcmGStRn https://t.co/x7qRF8rcTT

.@UNFPA works to promote universal access to sexual & reproductive health & rights, including family planning. 

More on how they're helping women & girls in more than 150 countries around the world. https://t.co/qgOwD3O8e8 https://t.co/FiLUey80m1

Despite #COVID19, the @iaeaorg continues its important work promoting the safe, secure & peaceful use of nuclear technologies & helping prevent the spread of nuclear weapons. 

See how their efforts are helping create a safer world. https://t.co/xlYM84Oybd
https://t.co/hGF0jaz60R

One year into #COVID19, more than half of the world’s student population still faces significant disruptions to their education.

@UNESCO is supporting countries to mitigate the immediate impact of school closures. https://t.co/62rBtBDmXi https://t.co/zbVlgK1JVj

"2021 is a critical year for climate and biodiversity."

-- @antonioguterres calls on every city, company & financial institution to adopt concrete #ClimateAction plans & get to carbon neutrality by 2050. https://t.co/A68StYHf3n https://t.co/JM9Mqq5EER

“Libyans are keen to turn the page, to reclaim Libyan sovereignty & ownership of their destiny as a people after many years of relentless armed conflict.”

-- Stephanie Williams, head of @UNSMILibya, tells Security Council. https://t.co/Ii4VbUDTfp

"We must get to work to make sure the vaccine is available to everyone, everywhere. With this pandemic, none of us are safe until all of us are safe."

-- @antonioguterres after getting his #COVID19 vaccine in NYC on Thursday. https://t.co/LbuEmA2hfw

"2020 was a year of death, disaster & despair. 2021 must be the year to change gear & put the world on track."

-- @antonioguterres says solidarity will help ensure the world will recover better from #COVID19 & overcome other challenges facing humankind. https://t.co/6XlBlfodTE https://t.co/wlrHazhTUc
@lang_lang Congratulations and best wishes to the whole family!

#COVID19 has resulted in children missing classes -- and meals. 

A  new @WFP & @UNICEFInnocenti report explores the impact of school closures on children’s nutrition: https://t.co/yoLFMrmHQD https://t.co/YKyvhoJHcP

"Now is the time to secure the well-being of people, economies, societies and our planet. It is possible. So we must make it happen. Together."

-- @antonioguterres has outlined his major priorities for 2021, including #COVID19, #ClimateAction & more. https://t.co/A68StYHf3n https://t.co/8hfz761Fs5

Despite the challenge of #COVID19 & harsh winter conditions, the men & women #ServingForPeace with the @UNPeacekeeping mission in Lebanon continue their work to preserve stability in the country. 

More on @UNIFIL_: https://t.co/qqVehXlyFO https://t.co/gKwh0ig1zL

Good #ClimateAction news from the European Union: 
In 2020 - for the first time - renewables generated more electricity than fossil fuels.

@UNFCCC explains why a swift transition to sustainable energy is important: https://t.co/FwIEYb5uEI

https://t.co/xocJZfqGHV

Job losses due to #COVID19 resulted in massive increases in poverty & inequalities, with the number of people living in extreme poverty rising by 131M in 2020.

Latest @UNDESA's #WorldEconomyReport shows how we can speed up an equitable, green recovery: https://t.co/r3kpmvJRp3 https://t.co/gDN3oDKdHt

Nurses
doctors
teachers
sanitation workers
journalists
truck drivers
grocery store workers
researchers
& all essential workers

are risking their well-being to serve their communities.

We thank them for being on the front lines during the #COVID19 pandemic.

🎨: Chiara Fiori https://t.co/vu8qgbitzi

Handover of former Central African Republic militia leader & war crimes suspect to @IntlCrimCourt sends strong warning to others who thrive on impunity, a UN independent human rights expert said on Wednesday.
https://t.co/hW5UnPcfDa

💉 Delivering life-saving vaccines
🍲 Providing food aid
👤 Supporting mental health

Around the world, the UN family is scaling up efforts to fight the #COVID19 pandemic. See examples in our latest @TwitterMoments:
https://t.co/lmVmXiHvDM

In a ceremony marking #HolocaustRemembranceDay, world leaders joined UN officials on Wednesday to urge people everywhere to honour the victims of the Holocaust and take a stand against antisemitism. https://t.co/8DZNVT0QnW

🌳 Forest & land conservation
☀ Renewable energy
🌾 Climate-friendly farming techniques
👷‍♀️ Green businesses & jobs

These are the top 4 #ClimateAction policies people around the world want to see, according to @UNDP's #PeoplesClimateVote. https://t.co/vfKKW8yKLY

On Wednesday's #HolocaustRemembranceDay we honour the memory of the six million Jews & millions of others who perished in the Holocaust.

Let us stand united against antisemitism, bigotry and hatred -- today, and every day. https://t.co/wvs1K8xQkR https://t.co/hGHSKpLz0v

Constituents who are asking questions & raising issues are very powerful. 

-- UN Envoy Mark Carney explains that everyone can take #ClimateAction by asking politicians, companies & banks how they are addressing the climate crisis. https://t.co/e3piyn8iCR https://t.co/E7vpOqOr0D

We can all help #ProtectTheFacts and ensure the Holocaust is not denied, excused, minimised or misrepresented.

Learn more on Wednesday's #HolocaustRemembranceDay. https://t.co/uJ3Y1FoTkg https://t.co/pvSNgoSd3h

"This year must be a year of healing -- healing from the pandemic, and healing our broken societies in which hatred has all too easily taken root."

-- @antonioguterres on Wednesday's #HolocaustRemembranceDay. https://t.co/wvs1K8Prcp https://t.co/JIqk16efyO

9 out of 10 people around the world breathe highly polluted air. 

Be a #ClimateAction superhero - bike, walk or take public transport whenever possible to help protect our air from dangerous fumes. https://t.co/nAjeCAHlAC #ActNow https://t.co/kzMW9yEY40

The Holocaust began with words, and today, the power of propaganda is more devastating than ever. 

But education & knowledge can help prevent genocide.

Wednesday is #HolocaustRemembranceDay. https://t.co/9qzG3QbrPg via @UNESCO https://t.co/iVGhzWidJI

With #COVID19 exacerbating existing challenges, increased support is needed for peacebuilding, alongside a renewed approach to multilateralism, @antonioguterres stresses at @UNPeacebuilding conference. https://t.co/XCXq1c3y4T

"As we remember those who died in the Holocaust and honour the survivors, our best tribute is the creation of a world of equality, justice and dignity for all." 

-- @antonioguterres on Wednesday's #HolocaustRemembranceDay. https://t.co/wvs1K8Prcp https://t.co/96TkZ7g08Y

“Elections are a crucial part of building a democratic Palestinian State built on rule of law, with equal rights for all.”

-- New UN envoy Tor Wennesland to Security Council. https://t.co/yWahS1kqOb
